Woman commits suicide

Upset over husband’s refusal to return from abroad, a 28-year-old woman committed suicide at her residence here on Tuesday evening.

The police said that Rajendran of Pethanaickenpalayam went abroad after his marriage with Mahalakshmi.

He used to speak to her over phone.

He did not return despite her repeated request.

On Wednesday, she poured kerosene on her and set herself ablaze.

Goondas Act invoked

The police have invoked sections of Goondas Act against S. Alagu alias Thambidurai (27), P. Vijay Ananth (27) and A. Manikandan (27), all of Chinna Kaavur in Mettur, for killing R. Senthil Kumar of Thangamapuri Pattinam in Mettur on

December 1, 2015. Senthil Kumar, a life convict, was on bail.

Warning

Chief Educational Officer A. Gnanagowri has asked teachers and non-teaching staff of government-aided and government schools not to work part-time in private schools.

She said that according to the Right to Education Act, government teachers should not take classes in private schools.

She said that stern action would be taken against such teachers.
title: TAMIL NADU
